moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nd4: The Bird Defence -- as handled by Bird himself.
moves.4. Nxd4 exd4 5. O-O Bc5: Bird does not hesitate to be aggressive.
moves.6. c3 Ne7 7. d3 c6 8. Bc4: A mistake by White. Now the Bishop is almost useless, with the pawns on a2, d3 and e4 severely restricting its mobility.
moves.8... O-O 9. Bg5 Kh8: Preventing a potential Bxf7+ and preserving the initiative.
moves.11. Bxf6: White attempts to force through his attack with a sacrifice...
moves.11... d5: ...and overlooks this devastating response. The game is now virtually lost for White.
moves.13. exd5 Rxf2: After this devastating strike, White resigns. If 14 Rxf2, Black follows up with 14... Qe1 ch 15 Rf1 dxc3 dis ch 16 Kh1 Qxf1 mate.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C61), Bird's defence, Paulsen variation
